title: 10 Ways to Keep a Girl Interested over Text

steps.title: It will make her feel good about herself.
steps.content: It will make her feel good about herself. Plus, you can tell her how cool she is so she gets the message that you like her. If your conversation is getting a little boring, flatter her with something about her personality. Stay away from anything about her looks, since that might make her uncomfortable. Try things like: [1] X Research source “I love talking to you. You always know how to make me laugh!” “You have the best taste out of anyone I know. Could you help me pick a birthday gift for my sister?” “I can’t believe you got the best grade in our class. You’re so smart!”

steps.title: Pick questions she can’t answer with “yes” or “no.”
steps.content: Pick questions she can’t answer with “yes” or “no.” It will keep your conversation flowing well, and you can answer the questions as you go along, too. [2] X Expert Source Imad Jbara Dating Coach Expert Interview. 5 November 2019. If you think of anything to ask her, try rephrasing it so she answers with a full sentence or a paragraph. Try things like: [3] X Research source “Which do you prefer: dogs or cats?” “If you could live anywhere in the world, where would it be?” “What’s your favorite video game?”

steps.title: Show her that you remember your previous conversations.
steps.content: Show her that you remember your previous conversations. If there’s anything you two talked about previously that you want to talk about again, bring it up in a funny, casual way. You could also ask her how a specific event went or how her hobbies are going. Try something like: [4] X Research source “So, you said you’re Drake’s biggest fan? What’d you think of his latest single?” “You said you had a swim meet yesterday, right? How’d that go?” “Have you been rock climbing a lot this summer? It’s been so nice out!”

steps.title: You don’t have to brag, but try to show her that you’re interesting.
steps.content: You don’t have to brag, but try to show her that you’re interesting. [5] X Expert Source Imad Jbara Dating Coach Expert Interview. 5 November 2019. Maybe you just went on vacation, bought a new car, or got a new pet. If there’s anything cool that just happened to you, tell her about it over text to keep her interested in you. Say something like: [6] X Research source “OMG, the craziest thing just happened to me. I went to Starbucks and I saw Jenna Fischer ordering a latte! I was way too nervous to say hi.” “I just adopted a new dog! His name is Rocky, he’s the cutest thing ever.”

steps.title: Get to know her personally over texts.
steps.content: Get to know her personally over texts. You can ask about her childhood, her goals, and her aspirations in life. The more you talk about deep things like these, the more you two will form a connection. Ask questions like: [7] X Research source “Who are you closest to in your family?” “What’s a happy memory from your childhood?” “Where do you see yourself in 10 years?”

steps.title: If you know her IRL, make fun of something silly that’s happened.
steps.content: If you know her IRL, make fun of something silly that’s happened. Maybe you have a math teacher who’s never on time to class, or maybe you saw a really bad movie together last week. Remind her of it and make her laugh by saying something like: [8] X Research source “Uh oh, I’m running late today. You might as well call me Mr. Brown.” “Saw a dog today that totally reminded me of the movie we saw. I can’t believe how terrible it was!”

steps.title: Bring up something silly that you two can “fight” over.
steps.content: Bring up something silly that you two can “fight” over. Pick something totally random, like whether or not a hot dog is a sandwich. It will pique her interest, and you two can disagree over text while having a funny conversation. For instance: [9] X Research source “Is Santa Claus evil? Why or why not?” “Being a dog mom is a full time job. Agree or disagree?” “Can soup be a drink?”

steps.title: Spice up your conversation with a few fun pics.
steps.content: Spice up your conversation with a few fun pics. If you’re out and about, text her about what you’re doing and send along a photo to show her your perspective. You can also send her these over Snapchat , but there’s something a little more special about messaging them to her directly. [10] X Research source For instance, if you’re watching a football game in person, you might send a pic of the field at half time. Or, if you’re at a water park, take a quick selfie in front of the slides.

steps.title: This can really throw off a conversation.
steps.content: This can really throw off a conversation. If she’s asking you questions or sending you messages, don’t reply with just “yup” or “okay.” [11] X Expert Source Imad Jbara Dating Coach Expert Interview. 5 November 2019. She might think you’re not interested, and she could even stop texting you all together. [12] X Research source You should also try to avoid texting her more than twice in a row. Sending double texts can seem a little desperate, and you don’t want to come on too strong.

steps.title: Texting is nice, but an in-person convo is even better.
steps.content: Texting is nice, but an in-person convo is even better. If you can, try to steer the conversation toward meeting up in real life as soon as possible. [13] X Expert Source Imad Jbara Dating Coach Expert Interview. 5 November 2019. You can suggest a place to get the ball rolling and see what she says. [14] X Research source Say something like, “I’ve had a ton of fun talking to you over text. Would you want to grab coffee this weekend?” Or, “I know you like hiking—wanna show me a trail this weekend?” Reader Poll: We asked 1004 wikiHow readers about the best ways to build a connection with someone they like over text, and only 10% of people recommended bringing up super deep, philosophical topics . [Take Poll] Instead, wait until you see her in person to dive into serious topics!
